result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles H. Vetrone Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Attorney fee deposits in the amount of $670 have been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

No contact with K.A.W. directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party. Defendant is prohibited from having contact with any females under the age of 18 unless they are in the presence of a parent or guardian or unless they are the defendant's own children. The court will authorize contact with female children under the age of 18 if written consent is provided to the supervising agent by the parent or guardian of the child.
Defendant to comply with any terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:44 p.m. Defendant Charles H. Vetrone in court with attorney Jeffrey Thomas Haase.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to 4th Degree Sexual Assault contrary to Wis Stat 940.225(3m).  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by Atty Haase regarding sentencing. No statement by DE. Court orders: 9 mos WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 2 years probation - Conditions: Defendant is prohibited from having contact with K.A.W., Defendant is prohibited from having contact with any females under the age of 18 unless they are in the presence of a parent or guardian or unless they are the defendant's own children, the court will authorize contact with other female children under the age of 18 if written consent is provided to the supervising agent by the parent or guardian of that child, any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, atty fees w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Charles H. Vetrone in court with attorney Jeffrey Thomas Haase.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Haase requesting a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Status conference on November 3, 2014 at 02:10 pm.

1:45 pm case called. Defendant Charles H. Vetrone in court with attorney Jeffrey Thomas Haase.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. Preliminary hearing and time limits discussed. Attorney Haase states defendant is willing to waive the right to the preliminary hearing.  Court quesitons defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court has read the criminal complaint, and find probable cause that a felony has been committed within the courts jurisdiction and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial of said charges.  Information filed with the court. Attorney Haase confirms receipt, waives further reading. NGP entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 02:10 pm.
Initial appearance on September 23, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Case Called @ 1:32 PM: Defendant Charles H. Vetrone in court.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wishes to have counsel.  Def was not eligible for SPD services due to employment.  Based upon earnings, Court willing to appoint counsel upon the payment of a deposit of $250 no later than 8/29/14.  $100 per mo PP to commence 10/1/14 without interruption.  AIA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
